quest.name: Her Last Vow
journal: Julyan would send you on your way.

Assuring you that she will look after Hildibrand in your absence, Julyan urges you to hurry to the Sil'dih excavation site, where Ellie intends to obtain the lost supply of zombie powder and exact her ultimate revenge against Ul'dah. Hasten to the scene, and rendezvous with Phillice upon your arrival.

Phillice and the others have located the fugitive Ellie, who stubbornly refuses to engage in conversation with her pursuers. Fearing the worst were an attempt to be made to apprehend her quarry by force, Phillice urges you to call out to your friend, and see if she might still be made to listen to reason. Step forward to where she might hear you, and, with the chat mode in Say, call out “Ellie!” to attract her attention.

Ellie responds to you, but refuses to stand down, insisting that her quest for justice against those who wronged her homeland is more important than her and Cecy's very lives. A pack of zombies that she summons to attack are dispatched by Godbert and Gilgamesh, yet the undead legions keep coming. Just when you appear hopelessly outnumbered, a blinding light from on high heralds the arrival of none other than Inspector Hildibrand, with considerably more color in his cheeks than when last you saw him. Illogical as it may seem, it would appear that his own time spent in the company of the undead allowed him to develop an immunity to the Traders' Spurn. With the zombies now at the side of their erstwhile overlord, Ellie surrenders, bringing the case of the many-faced thief to an unexpected but satisfying end. Your work is not done, however, as the ever-enterprising Gilgamesh has taken advantage of the confusion to take into hand the Treaty-Blade, insisting that he will not relinquish the relic except to one who defeats him and his companion Enkidu at Amdapor Keep. Make for the South Shroud, and rendezvous with Hildibrand, whose legs have likely carried him to your destination well in advance.

You arrive before Amdapor Keep to find Hildibrand in a familiar position. Assuring you that he will be along as soon as he completes his subterranean investigation, the inspector urges you to commence the battle against your rivals in hopes of reclaiming the Treaty-Blade.

※The Battle in the Big Keep can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
You have emerged victorious over Gilgamesh and his primal companion, Enkidu. Leave the keep and return to the South Shroud.

You emerge from the keep to observe that a certain inspector has finally extricated himself from the forest floor. Inform Hildibrand that the battle has been won, and the location of the Treaty-Blade gleaned.

Phillice and the others arrive at the scene, rejoicing at the news that the primal menace has been quelled, as Ellie and Cecy share the story of one last unsolved mystery: an incantation of Belah'dian legend whose great power can only be summoned forth by a Warrior of Light with the Treaty-Blade in hand. The conversation is interrupted by Hildibrand, who has successfully recovered that selfsame relic. The inspector, by mere coincidence, speaks something resembling the final words of the incantation, and─against all common sense─the Treaty-Blade responds, casting forth a brilliant beam of light that propels both blade and unsuspecting passenger into the heavens. A smile comes to Ellie's face, her dream of seeing the legendary power of her ancestors with her own eyes finally realized. Inspector Briardien is pleased to be rid of his incompetent rival, yet strangely moved by his inimitable gentlemanliness. Nashu and Julyan run off in search of the beloved inspector and son, as Godbert muses on the true calling of a Manderville man. Meanwhile, high above Eorzea, Hildibrand hurtles off to destinations unknown, as his keenly honed inspector's sense calls him to his next case. One can only hope that he will survive his inevitable landing with his memory intact...

※The next Hildibrand quest will be available from Nashu Mhakaracca in Ishgard once you have completed the main scenario quest “Heavensward.”
objectives: Speak with Phillice at the Sil'dih excavation site.
With the chat mode in Say, enter “Ellie!” to call out to your erstwhile companion.
Speak with Hildibrand near Amdapor Keep.
Confront Gilgamesh in the Battle in the Big Keep.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: What are ye doin' dillydallyin' around here? Let me jog yer memory: there's a moon-sick maid diggin' around at the Sil'dih excavation site with her mind set on turnin' Ul'dah into the land o' the walkin' dead!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Yer concern for Hildy is most touchin', but don't ye worry. Mommy dearest isn't goin' to let her beloved son kick the bucket that easily.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: What are ye doin' dillydallyin' around here? Let me jog yer memory: there's a moon-sick maid diggin' around at the Sil'dih excavation site with her mind set on turnin' Ul'dah into the land o' the walkin' dead!

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: We've managed to track down Miss Ellie just up ahead, where your friends watch over her as we speak. Yet no matter how many times we try to reach out to her, she refuses to so much as answer.

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: Needless to say, we considered physically incapacitating her. But that crate she's sitting on isn't just a makeshift chair; it's filled to the brim with the Traders' Spurn. One misstep, and the consequences could be dire indeed.

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: You are our only hope, Forename. Even in her single-minded rage, surely the time you spent together must still count for something!

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: You need not put yourself in undue danger. I only ask that you step forth to where your voice may be heard and call out your friend's name.

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: I beg of you, Forename! Surely if anyone can convince the woman to abandon her madness, it is you!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to call out “Ellie!” and convince your erstwhile friend and companion to listen to reason.

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: I beg of you, Forename! If anyone can convince Ellie to abandon this madness, it is you. Pray step forth to where your voice may be heard and call out her name!

dialogue.name: SAYTODO
dialogue.text: Ellie!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: It beggars belief that I could have been so blind...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Miss Ellie... <sniff> And I thought we were friends...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Oho! To think this girl and her sister were behind the crimes all along! I daresay this realm is awash with capable adversaries!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: You'd do well not to anger the lass, friend. She's sitting atop an ample supply of that zombie powder, and I suspect she's not afraid to use it.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: ...Forename. I suggest you leave this place while you still can. I bear you no grudge, but should you so much as think of interfering, I'll not hesitate to turn you into a zombie too.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: So it was you, after all. Consider me...disappointed.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Your sister Cecy is already in custody. Surrender now and I will see that no harm befalls her.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: How little you understand us, Inspector... Then again, how could one born into a life of power and privilege ever hope to understand?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Cecy and I have no family, no friends, no fortune...nothing. Two sisters against the world, with only our quest for justice to give us meaning. Long ago, we made a vow─should the worst happen, our mission takes priority over all. Yes, over our own wretched lives...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Do you see now? Anything I might have once had to lose, I lost long ago. Now stand down, or suffer the same fate as the Ul'dahn dogs you would defend!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Ellie, stop this madness!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: ...I'm sorry, Inspector.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: There's too many of them!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: All in a day's work for a Manderville man. And now...it's hammer time.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: You only delay the inevitable. I have an entire legion of the undead at my beck and call. Face it, it's only with Inspector Hildibrand's ridiculously good fortune that you even made it this far. And he's as good as six fulms under!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Be forewarned, girl! Know that I speak from experience when I say: underestimate Hildy, and you do so at your own peril!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I'm afraid you underestimate me as well. No mere splash of holy water can stave off the effects of the Traders' Spurn. I fear the good inspector's luck has finally run out.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Thal's balls, is there no end to them!? I'm not liking our chances...Greg, was it?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: It's a shame to lose you, Forename. Warrior of Light that you are, you might yet have served one last purpose for us...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Go forth, my zombie minions!

dialogue.name: HUMPHREY
dialogue.text: “When darkness falls, and hope fades to despair, four warriors born of Light shall descend, in the righteous glare...” Bugger me with a broadsword, are my eyes to be believed!?

dialogue.name: HUMPHREY
dialogue.text: That pose... No, these are not four Warriors of Light that I see...

dialogue.name: HUMPHREY
dialogue.text: They are four Gentlemen of Light!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Just so, my good man! Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, has made his triumphant return! ...Did you miss me?

dialogue.name: ELEAZAR
dialogue.text: Aye, we meet again, girl! Tell me you've got my snurble tonic, or I'll fashion myself a wig from yer lovely locks after I've ripped them clean from yer bloody head!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Oh, hullo there, Mister Eleazar! Cor, you're looking absolutely resplendent today!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I-Impossible! The holy water couldn't have cured him!

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA00493
dialogue.text: ...It didn't. Fortunately, our overlord spent quite some time building up an immunity to zombie powder!

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEB00493
dialogue.text: When we heard that Master Zombibrand was at risk of joining the actual dead, we knew we had to take action.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: An...immunity...to...? <sigh> I'm just going to pretend that makes any kind of sense.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The game is up, Miss Ellie. Pray abandon this madness. Besides, plots of mass murder hardly suit a lady like yourself.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: It's over... It's all...over. Inspector Briardien. You said there was something you would tell me when all was through. I imagine you have no words for me now...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Ellie...your powers of deduction are wanting. You said that you had lost everything and everyone you had to lose, did you not? As for me, I have found something─someone─with whom I intend never to part.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: I care not if it takes years, even decades. When you emerge from your gaol cell a free woman...I will be there. What say you?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: ...Miss Ellie. While the crimes perpetrated by you and your sister are unpardonable, you are far from the only ones guilty. On behalf of the Syndicate, I offer my apologies for the false aspersions cast upon your ancestors.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: You said that the nation of Ul'dah was built on lies. Seeing what I have seen today, I cannot deny your words. It will not be an easy task to rewrite─nay, restore─history, but know this: I will do everything in my power to bring the truth to the fore.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: ...Ahem! Are we not forgetting someone here? And by someone, I mean me!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: If you're quite done playing cloak and dagger, I require Forename's presence for a matter of far greater importance. Aye, the time of our too-long-delayed confrontation is nigh!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Why the long face, friend? Ah, but mayhap this will have you singing a happier tune!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Could it be!? The Treaty-Blade─and the true one, at that!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: None other! And I have not the slightest intention of parting with it, save to the one who would defeat me in single combat! Ah, but I misspeak─it will not be single combat this time...

dialogue.name: ENKIDU
dialogue.text: Is that my cue...old friend?

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: Thal be merciful! What is that abomination!? Some new breed of voidsent?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text:
Abomination!? I'll thank you to address my companion with courtesy, girl! Ah, but 'twas the most curious thing: there I was, hauling a crateful of crystals for Hildy's mother, and thinking how much better things would be if my dear friend Enkidu were here...
Then came a flash from the heavens, and the next thing I knew...there she was!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: By the gods, it makes perfect sense! Doubtless the crystals heard Greg's heartfelt plea, summoning forth his friend─nay, no mere friend, but rather the primal Enkidu!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...And the world has now completely and utterly ceased to be bound by the laws of logic.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Forename! You may have bested me in the past, but facing the two of us together will not prove so easy a task. And yet, I trust you will not shirk from the challenge. Aye, Enkidu and I shall await you at Amdapor Keep!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: 'Tis a ways from here, but what better venue for our climactic confrontation? If you would claim the Treaty-Blade, then claim it from me as a warrior. To the skies, Enkidu... To the skies!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Two against one? That's not very gentlemanly of you, Greg! Come, Forename─to Amdapor!

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: This is a grave development, indeed. To think that one man could summon a primal on his own! I must send word to the Scions at once...

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: Oh, but of course! I had near forgotten we had a Warrior of Light in our very midst! Please, Forename! You are our only hope to slay the primal and reclaim the blade!

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: After four hundred years, this might very well spell the end for the Arbiters of Truth.

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: Whether or not to replace the fallen is a decision for my superiors to make. In either event, I have decided to renounce my position. I thought they were but white lies, but I have seen firsthand the suffering they can cause...

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: (-Cecy-)Ellie... Forgive me...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry for deceiving you, Forename. For what it's worth, it wasn't personal.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: And with that, my work here is done. You were by far the least incompetent associate I encountered in my travels. For preserving some shred of my sanity, you have my thanks.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: That said, my time in this land was not a total loss. My experiences here have taught me an important lesson: that this world and the fools who populate it rarely─if ever─abide by the principles of logic. This should serve me well in my future cases.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: And most importantly of all, I leave here with a vow that has given my life new meaning. ...Ahem, but this is no time for sentiment.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Look at the inspector go! I'm right behind you, Inspector!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ho ho ho! I knew that if anything could bring Hildy back from the undead, it would be my dear wife's hand-mixed holy water! That's the world-class culinarian I married!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: All's well that ends well, eh, Forename? Hildy's undead acquaintances were kind enough to make an appearance at my request. Who'd have thought zombies could be such gentlemen? I reckon it must be my son's good influence!

dialogue.name: HUMPHREY
dialogue.text: The Gentlemen of Light! Cor, they were every bit as radiant as I pegged them to be! One day...one day I'll be a hero myself, just you watch!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ahem! Is that you, Forename? Pray forgive me─I was right on Greg's trail when I encountered a subterranean curiosity that demanded my immediate attention.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I will be concluding my investigation forthwith, but in the meantime, might I trouble you to entertain Greg and his primal friend in my stead?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Together we will reclaim the Treaty-Blade from that knave, Forename! Yes, ah, just go on ahead─I'll be along directly.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Together we will reclaim the Treaty-Blade from that knave, Forename! Yes, ah, just go on ahead─I'll be along directly.

dialogue.name: MAXINNE
dialogue.text: A giant of a man dressed in red rushed into the keep at great speed, leaving me powerless to stop him. You don't suppose he was one of the cultists!?

dialogue.name: MAXINNE
dialogue.text: Are you quite all right, friend? I heard a most ghastly sound from within. That aside, is that muscular fellow an acquaintance of yours? He seemed quite concerned for your well-being.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: What ho, Forename! Have you seen Greg and his oversized avian companion!? Lead me to them at once, and we shall deliver the coup de grâce together!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The battle has already been won? That is triumphant news, indeed! Clearly, the lessons you have learned from me have not been for naught. And what's this, you say? The Treaty–Blade lies hidden somewhere in the nearby wood?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Worry not, my ever-loyal associate, for no buried treasure will escape the keen eye of Hildibrand, agent of enquiry and inspector extraordinaire! Now, which way was the forest again...?

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: Forename! What news of the primal and the Treaty–Blade!?

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: Remarkable! I knew the Warrior of Light would emerge triumphant! Let us hope that Inspector Hildibrand enjoys similar success in finding the blade...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Such design! Such craftsmanship! At once bold and powerful, yet sensitive and refined. I believe I've found the inspiration for my next masterpiece!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: ...Of course they're beautiful. They were the greatest treasures of lost Sil'dih. To think that they were locked away in the vaults of those that destroyed our homeland and dragged our ancestors' names through the mud...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: And just how did you come to know of these long-lost relics?

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: There was an ancient scroll passed down in our family, left to us by our dear grandmother. It spoke of the four Warriors of Light, their four relics, and an incantation of untold power. If we could have wielded this magic of legend, Ellie and I might still have had the last laugh.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Alas, speaking the words had no effect. Only a Warrior of Light can wield the power, or so the legend goes. Ah, what I wouldn't have given to see it─the ultimate achievement of the greatest mages this realm has ever known...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: And just what sort of incantation is this?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text:
“The Ring casts open the doors of justice,
The Wiseman whispers a verdict true.
Azeyma's virtue shines down from the Heavens...”

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: ...To complete the incantation, the Warrior of Light would then hold forth the Treaty–Blade and speak, “Blade in hand, I swear unto you.” The legends differ as to what happens next, but all speak of a great holy radiance shining down from the heavens...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Over here, friends! Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, returns with tidings most triumphant!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Behold! Safe in my hands, none other than the Treaty–Blade. And the real one, this time, I swear unto you!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Yes, yes...just like that. “I swear unto you,” then...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: My word! Whatever is this odd tingling sensation?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: R-Ridiculous! Hildibrand isn't a Warrior of Light! He's just some fool who thought he could stop the lesser moon with his own bare hands!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: It would seem the Treaty-Blade is just as confused as the rest of us.

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: No... The light... Someone stop it! I won't stand to see the legendary power of our forefathers wielded by this muscle-bound buffoon!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Skyward hoooooooooooooooooo!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Well. I daresay that proved to be a most useful incantation, indeed.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: And so the light of justice that shone from the Treaty–Blade banished the shadow, returning peace to the land.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: ...So the legend ended. I must say, I never expected it to be quite literally a beam of light. I suppose it wouldn't have been much use to us, after all.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Inspector! Oh, Inspector! Wait for meeeeeeeeeeeeeee!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Thal's balls, Hildy! First ye almost die at yer poor mother's feet, and now ye fly off to gods know where without even givin' her a kiss good-bye!?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ho ho ho! It appears that a case of wanderlust has once again struck Hildibrand─as it has many a Manderville man before him. Godsspeed, my boy! When the day comes that you tire of mystery solving, your dear old man will be here to pass on to you the family art.

dialogue.name: PHILLICE
dialogue.text: So in the end, the Sil'dihn incantation of legend was wielded not by a Warrior of Light, but a Gentleman of Light...?

dialogue.name: CECY
dialogue.text: Well, the Treaty–Blade is some six centuries old, after all. Perhaps it's not quite as sharp as it used to be...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: The magic that brought peace and happiness to the people of Belah'dia. It was...every bit as beautiful as I imagined. To think I would see it with my own eyes─it's nothing short of a dream come true.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Hmph. He bumbles and stumbles through yet another case, and still he manages to make a girl's dream come true.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: A gentleman to the end...the bloody bastard.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: What's this!? A glint in the corner of my eye? A curious scent, wafting in on the winds from a far-flung land!? Do I smell...a case!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Worry not for me, my friends! For wherever the wronged want for succor, I, Hildibrand, shall be there! Till we meet again!

obj.n: A Gentleman Falls, Rather than Flies
